channel.title: script on ₿itcoin Transcripts
channel.description: Recent content in script on ₿itcoin Transcripts

item.title: Miniscript
item.description: Topic: Miniscript: Composable, Analyzable and Smarter Bitcoin Script Andrew Poelstra on Miniscript: https://btctranscripts.com/london-bitcoin-devs/2020-02-04-andrew-poelstra-miniscript/ Intro (Jeff Gallas) The next speaker is Sanket. He is working at Blockstream and is mostly working on Simplicity and Miniscript and that is also what he is going to talk about, Miniscript. Please welcome Sanket. Intro (Sanket Kanjalkar) Good morning everyone. Today I will be discussing Miniscript which is a work of Pieter Wuille, Andrew Poelstra and me with input from many Bitcoiners.

item.title: Sydney Socratic Seminar
item.description: Name: Socratic Seminar Topic: Agenda in Google Doc below Location: Bitcoin Sydney (online) Video: No video posted online Google Doc of the resources discussed: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1E9mzB7fmzPxZ74WZg0PsJfLwjpVZ7OClmRdGQQFlzoY/ The conversation has been anonymized by default to protect the identities of the participants. Those who have expressed a preference for their comments to be attributed are attributed. If you were a participant and would like your comments to be attributed please get in touch.

item.title: Bitcoin Scripting
item.description: Topic: Advanced Bitcoin Scripting Location: SF Bitcoin Devs Mastering Bitcoin on GitHub: https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook Intro Today’s talk is different from some of the other talks I’ve done so bear with me. We are going to do this slowly in a very casual manner. This is not one of my usual talks where I am going to tell you about big picture vision and stuff like that. What I want to do is talk about some interesting features of Bitcoin Script and explain them.
